div.l: ¶ A Mile of brede of twenty fote offe space
Lat see now yif this place may suffise
Ore make it Rowmere wᵗith speche as is yowre gyze
¶ Now symkin seyde Iohn by seynt Cvtberd
Ay is thow Merie and this is fayre asswerd
I have herd saye men schall take offe twoo thynggis
Swilke as hee fyntte ore tale sulke as hee brynggis
But specially I praye thee Ooste so dere
Gete vs mete ⁊and drynk and Make vs good chere
And wee wille paye trewlye atte thee fulle
Wᵗith empty hond men may nowt hawkis tolle
Loo here Owre selvir redy forto spendde
This Mellere in to thee town his dowghtter sende
For ale and breed and rostyd hen and goos
And bond here hors hit scholde nowt goo loos
And in his owne chawmbre hee madde a bedde
Wᵗith schetis and wᵗith chalowms Fayre spredde
Nowt fram his owne bed ten fote ore twelue
¶ His dowghter hadde a bed all by here selve
Ryght in thee same Chawmber by and by
Hit myghtte been no bette and cavze why
There was no rowmere herberwe in that place
They sowpen and they speken hem to solace
And dryncken evere strong ale atte thee beste
And abowte Midnyght wenttēn they to reste
Full weell hath this Mellere vernichsschid his heed
Full pale was hee for drvnke and nowt Reed
Hee yixede and hee spekyht thorghw thee nose
As hee were on thee quacke ore on thee pose
To bedde hee gooht and wᵗith hym gooht his wyif
As any iay hee lyght was and iolyif
¶ Soo were here ioly whistelis weell I wette
Thee cradell at thee beddis feet was sette
To rokken and to yeve thee chyild to sowke
And whanne drvnken was all that in the krowke
To bedde wentte the dowghtter Ryght anon
To bedde gooht aleyn and also dede Iohn
Theer ne was no more hem nedede no dwale
This Melnere hath so wyislye bibbid good ale
That as an hors hee fnortyht in his sleepe
Noo offe his tayle bee hynde ne toke hee no kepe
¶ His wyif bare hym a burdone a full strongge
Men myghte heere here Rowtyngge a fowrlongge
Thee wenche rowtyht also ꝑper cvmpanye
¶ Aleyn thee clerk that herde this melodye
Hee pokyht Iohn and seyde slepist thow
Herdest thow evere swiche a songe ere now
Loo whiche cowplyngge is bee twixe hem all
A wyilde fyire vppon here bodyis falle
Whoo herde evere swiche a ferly thyng
Yee they schall have thee flowr of evell endyng
This longe nyght ne tydis mee no reste
But yit no foors all schal bee for thee beste
For Iohn hee seyde soo evere mote I thrive
Yif that I may yone wenche wole I swive
Svm esement hath lawe schapen to vs
For Iohn theer is a lawe that seyht thus
¶ That yif a man in oopoynt bee agrevid
That in another hee schall bee relevid
Owre corn is stole sohtlye it is no nay
And wee han had an ill fitte all this day
And syin I schall haue noon other Amendement
Ageyn my losse I wole haue esement
By goddis sowle hit schall non other bee
¶ This Iohn ansswerde aleyn avyse thee
Thee Melnere is a perlous man hee seyde
And yif that hee owt offe his slep a breyde
Hee myte done vs bothe a velanye
Aleyn ansswerde I cownte hym nowt a flye
And vp hee Rist and in by thee wenche hee krepte
This wenche lay vp ryght and faste sche slepte
Till hee so neygh was or sche myghtte asspie
That it hadde been to late forto Crye
And schortlye for to seye they weren atton
Now pleye on aleyn fore I wille speke of Iohn
¶ This Iohn lyght stille a furlong wey or twoo
And to hym self hee makyht rewthe ⁊and woo
Allas quod hee this is a wycked iap
